intro: Psychotria aurantiaca var. subplumbea, commonly known as the blue-veined psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking blue veins on its leaves, which contrast with its dark green foliage. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
